perturbation.original_text: Distributor shall begin such distribution within [ * ] following Google's request.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor shall begin such distribution within 24 hours following Google's request.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a potential legal contradiction because it mandates a very short turnaround time (24 hours) for the distributor to begin distributing the latest version of the Distribution Products following Google's request. Depending on the scope and complexity of the distribution, this timeframe might be unreasonably short and could be deemed commercially unfeasible or practically impossible, potentially conflicting with laws requiring reasonable notice and opportunity to comply with contractual obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of reasonableness and commercial feasibility; potential violation of implied duties of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: All payments under this Agreement shall be made in [ * ] in the [ * ] following the [ * ] for which the payments are applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: All payments under this Agreement shall be made at Google's discretion, whenever it deems appropriate following the period for which the payments are applicable.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a legal contradiction because it removes a fixed payment timeline, giving Google complete discretion over when payments are made. This violates principles of contract law requiring definite and certain payment terms and could be seen as an 'illusory promise,' rendering the payment obligation unenforceable. Labor and wage laws, depending on jurisdiction, may also mandate specific payment schedules.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of definiteness and certainty of terms; potential violation of state or federal wage and hour laws depending on what payments are for.

perturbation.original_text: Google shall within [ * ] following such expiration or termination pay to Distributor any undisputed amounts which have accrued from the time of the most recent payment to Distributor through the date of termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Google shall pay to Distributor any undisputed amounts which have accrued from the time of the most recent payment to Distributor through the date of termination or expiration of this Agreement only if Google deems it appropriate.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a legal contradiction because it gives Google complete discretion over whether or not to pay undisputed amounts owed to the distributor after the contract's termination. This violates fundamental contract law principles requiring parties to fulfill their financial obligations under a contract. It also undermines the concept of 'undisputed amounts', effectively rendering the obligation unenforceable. This could potentially conflict with laws related to final payment of services rendered, depending on the nature of the 'undisputed amounts.'
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles of obligation to pay for services rendered; potential violation of state and federal laws related to final payment requirements.
